business.headline: Explained: Why NIBE share price surged 5% to hit upper circuit todayNIBE share price: The shares of NIBE Ltd surged 5% to hit the upper circuit. The stock has lost 4.43% in the last 5 days, but has gained 18.22% in the past month.

Aegis Vopak Terminals IPO: Subscribe or skip Rs 2,800 crore listing? Check GMPBefore the public issue opened, the company raised Rs 1,259.99 crore from 32 anchor investors. This money was raised at the upper end of the price band, which is Rs 235 per share.

Eternal shares tumble over 3% in early trade. Why is the stock falling?The Zomato stock was trading 3.17% lower on the NSE at 9:38 am, making it the only significant laggard among Nifty50 constituents during morning trade.

Sensex gains 750 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayStock market rally: Sensex surged over 700 points to 82,437.76 in early trade, while Nifty gained over 200 points to 25,063.65 as of 9:50 am.

Sensex jumps over 600 points, Nifty crosses 25,000; Eternal tumbles 3%The BSE Sensex rose 704.45 points to 82,425.53 around 9:53 am while the Nifty50 gained 218.10 points to 25,071.25. Broader market indices were also in the green, reflecting widespread bullish sentiment on Dalal Street.

Leela Hotels IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPLeela Hotels plans to raise Rs 2,500 crore by issuing 5.75 crore fresh equity shares. An additional Rs 1,000 crore will be raised through the offer for sale (OFS) route, where existing shareholders will sell 2.30 crore shares.

Stock market today: Will Sensex, Nifty open higher on May 26?Market experts believe Nifty may continue to trade in a narrow range, with some key support and resistance levels in focus. Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,935.5 around 8:09 am, which is above Friday's closing level of 24,853.15 for Nifty50.

Stocks to watch on May 26: Hyundai, Swiggy, Eternal, Paytm, NTPC GreenHyundai Motor India, NTPC Green Energy, Swiggy, and Waaree Energies will be added to the FTSE global equity indices under the largecap category.

India overtakes Japan to become fourth-largest economy: Niti AayogIndia has overtaken Japan to become the world's 4th largest economy, with a GDP of $4 trillion. NITI Aayog projects India will become the 3rd largest economy in the next 2-3 years, surpassing Germany. Factors contributing to this growth include infrastructure development, Make in India initiative, GST implementation, and fiscal discipline during the COVID-19 pandemic. The country has reduced extreme poverty to less than 5% and is poised for rapid growth.

India now fourth-largest economy, ahead of Japan: Niti Aayog CEOIndia's GDP has reached $4 trillion, placing it behind only the US, China, and Germany, according to IMF data cited by NITI Aayog CEO BVR Subrahmanyam.

Trump targets Samsung after tax threat to Apple for India shift: Wouldn't be fairThe US President warned that Samsung, and not only Apple, would face a 25% import tax if its phones were not manufactured in America.

entertainment.headline: Aamir Khan, partner Gauri Spratt and son Azad step out for special lunch dateAamir Khan, his partner Gauri Spratt and his son Azad were seen visiting a plush restaurant in Mumbai for lunch. The trio were seen exiting the restaurant in a viral video.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 3: Heartland comedy wraps up decent 1st weekend Despite receiving mixed reviews, Rajkummar Rao's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' collected decently in its opening weekend. The film is set against the backdrop of a wedding and time loop.

Game Changer editor slams director Shankar's work ethics: Had terrible experience'Game Changer' editor Shameer Muhammed called out director Shankar's unprofessionalism in a recent interview. He said that the filmmaker would turn up 10 days late for editing and called it a 'terrible experience'.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 9: Fails to hit Rs 100 crore after 2nd weekendTom Cruise's 'Mission Impossible - The Final Reckoning' is eyeing Rs 110 crore - the lifetime collection of the previous film in the franchise. However, the film has slowed down with current collection in the range of Rs 72 crore after nine days.

Amitabh Bachchan salutes India's 'Agniveers', celebrates country's booming GDP Actor Amitabh Bachchan shared a series of posts on social media, praising India's rise as the fourth-largest economy in the world. He also shared a tribute to the Indian army.

Gayathri lifts Super Singer Junior 10 trophy, wins villa worth Rs 60 lakhGayathri won the title of Vijay Television's Super Singer Junior 10, while Nasreen became the first runner-up. Kamal Haasan and AR Rahman were the chief guests for the musical night.

Sophie Turner turns cheerleader for Joe Jonas's new divorce-inspired albumSophie Turner extended her support for her ex-husband Joe Jonas's solo album, 'Music for People Who Believe in Love'. This move came months after the two parted ways.

OG release date out: Pawan Kalyan's film to hit screens in SeptemberPawan Kalyan's much-awaited Telugu action film 'OG' is set to release in September25, 2025. Directed by Sujeeth and featuring music by S Thaman, the film will be a gripping mafia drama alongside a star-studded cast.

Actor Ravi's 'companion', blamed for divorce, takes legal action after rape threatsActor Ravi Mohan's 'companion' Keneeshaa Francis has taken legal action against online abuse, rape and death threats. Her move comes after Ravi called her his partner amid his divorce battle with Aarti.
BTS with Aishwarya Rai on Day 2 at Cannes, courtesy designer Gaurav GuptaDesigner Gaurav Gupta shared behind-the-scenes glimpses of Aishwarya Rai and her daughter Aaradhya on day 2 of Cannes.

K3G actor Malvika Raaj and husband Pranav Bagga announce pregnancy'Kabhie Khushi Kabhie Gham' actor Malvika Raaj and her husband Pranav Bagga are expecting their first child. She sharing the happy news with adorable photos on Instagram.

Crunchyroll Anime Awards 2025 Full Winners List: Solo Leveling bags Anime of the yearThe 2025 Crunchyroll Anime Awards held in Tokyo celebrated the best in anime with Solo Leveling emerging as the biggest winner. The star-studded event also honoured Attack on Titan for its cultural impact and featured performances by popular artists, making it a grand celebration of anime's global influence.

Preity Zinta donates Rs 1.10 crore to help Army widows, children after Op SindoorActor Preity Zinta donated Rs 1.10 crore to the Army Wives Welfare Association after India's Operation Sindoor. The actor made the generous donation at an event held in Jaipur on May 24.

Kuberaa teaser: Dhanush, Nagarjuna's film explores power and wealthThe teaser of 'Kuberaa' starring Dhanush and Rashmika Mandanna is finally out. Sekhar Kammula's pan-Indian directorial will release in theatres on June 20.

Ankhen: The sanskari spy who shunned martinis and saved India'Ankhen' remains a landmark spy thriller of 1968 Bollywood, blending patriotism, action, and strong female roles. The film's unique gadgets and nostalgic style made it a classic Indian cinema.
Allu Arjun waves at fans as he steps out for weekend outing. WatchActor Allu Arjun stepped out for a weekend outing on May 24. In a viral video, he is seen waving to fans as he exits a showroom.

Ram Gopal Varma says Triptii Dimri will be next big thing in Bollywood after SpiritFilmmaker Ram Gopal Varma shared a post on X and praised Sandeep Reddy Vanga for casting Triptii Dimri in 'Spirit.' The actor will be seen opposite Prabhas.

Shreya Ghoshal's tribute to armed forces with 'Maa Tujhe Salaam' rendition. WatchShreya Ghoshal concluded her 'All Hearts Tour' in Mumbai with a tribute to the Indian armed forces, performing 'Maa Tujhe Salaam' as a mark of respect.

Bold meets beauty: Urvashi Rautela, Alia Bhatt stun in viral Cannes selfieUrvashi Rautela shared a picture with Alia Bhatt from their Cannes appearance. Fans were thrilled to see two beautiful actors in one frame.

general news.headline: Heavy rain pounds Mumbai, streets waterlogged, flights and local trains affectedThe India Meteorological Department issued a warning for Mumbai on Monday morning, with a likely thunderstorm accompanied by lightning, intense spells of rain, and gusty winds in the city over the next 3 to 4 hours.

PM Modi holds roadshow in Gujarat in first visit since Operation SindoorPrime Minister Narendra Modi will launch development projects worth Rs 82,000 crore during his two-day visit to Gujarat on May 26-27.

What the hell...: Trump loses cool after Putin launches war's biggest air attackDonald Trump, who had been patient with Vladimir Putin, slammed him after Russia's largest airstrike on Ukraine killed 12. Calling out the violence, Trump said, "What the hell happened to him?"

New satellite image shows damage to Pak's Murid airbase in Indian strikeNew satellite image reveals damage caused to the Pakistan Air Force base in Murid after Indian Air Force's precise strike - Operation Sindoor.

Who can challenge Carlos Alcaraz on clay in the post-Nadal era? French Open 2025 ushers in a new era with Carlos Alcaraz poised to defend his crown. With Sinner surging, Djokovic seeking redemption, and dark horses in the mix, Paris is set for a gripping battle to decide the next ruler of Roland Garros.

Amitabh Bachchan salutes India's 'Agniveers', celebrates country's booming GDP Actor Amitabh Bachchan shared a series of posts on social media, praising India's rise as the fourth-largest economy in the world. He also shared a tribute to the Indian army.

Far more vulnerable: Himanta Sarma shares map of Bangladesh's '2 chicken necks'Intensifying his attack on Bangladesh's interim chief Muhammad Yunus, Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma asserted that the neighbouring country has "two chicken necks", which are far more vulnerable than India's Chicken Neck, also known as Siliguri Corridor.

Shehbaz Sharif thanks 'dear brother' Erdogan for backing Pak against IndiaTurkish President Erdogan met Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif in Istanbul weeks after the India-Pakistan conflict. They pledged to boost ties in defence, trade, and counter-terrorism. Erdogan reaffirmed support for Pakistan and called their bond "unbreakable."

Woman blames manager for fake 'Piyush Gupta' post, claims she was blackmailedJanney Hujic, a Singapore-based professional, went viral on May 21 after sharing a detailed post and a picture of her "chance encounter" with a man whom she mistook for former DBS Bank CEO Piyush Gupta.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

Nadal emotional as Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic join French Open tributeFrench Open 2025: Rafael Nadal was honoured at Roland Garros on Sunday in a powerful farewell ceremony that paid tribute to his unparalleled dominance on the Paris clay.

S Jaishankar, Canada's Foreign Minister hold first talks in bid to reset tiesThe conversation centred on strengthening economic cooperation and advancing shared priorities. It comes amid cautious optimism in New Delhi over a potential diplomatic reset ties with Ottawa following the exit of Justin Trudeau.

No 'foreign wife' shopping: China warns against marriage scams in BangladeshThe Chinese embassy in Bangladesh warned its citizens not to fall for deceptive "cross-border dating" content on short video platforms or seek out so-called "foreign wives" through informal networks or commercial matchmaking agencies,

11 injured in South Carolina beach town shooting, operation underway: PoliceAs many as 11 people were injured in a mass shooting on Sunday night in the South Carolina beach town of Little River, authorities said.

My privilege: Trump extends deadline for 50% EU tariffs until July 9US President Trump agreed to delay the planned 50% tariffs on EU goods until July 9 after a call with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. Ursula von der Leyen said talks would now proceed rapidly.

2.5-year-old girl raped by teacher at summer camp in MaharashtraA 2.5-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 45-year-old dance teacher at a summer camp in Maharashtra's Ulhasnagar. The accused was sent to three days of police custody by a local court.

Premier League final day: Who qualified for Champions, Europa and Conference leagueManchester City, Chelsea, and Newcastle United clinched their places in next season's Champions League. Meanwhile, Aston Villa's defeat at Manchester United consigned them to the Europa League, while Nottingham Forest's loss to Chelsea saw them slip into the Europa Conference League.

More terrorists in Pak than all over world: Ghulam Nabi Azad in BahrainGhulam Nabi Azad, who is part of the all-party delegation led by BJP MP Baijayant Jay Panda, is currently in Bahrain to covey India's anti-terror message.

Dhoni on IPL 2026 plans: Will enjoy a few bike rides in Ranchi and then decideMS Dhoni has said that he has time on his side and will make a decision on his IPL future in the coming few months. Dhoni said he will enjoy a 'few bike rides' in Ranchi and take the next couple of months to make the call.

Noida constable shot dead as mob attacks cops during arrest in GhaziabadA Noida constable, who was part of the team attempting to arrest a wanted accused in Ghaziabad, was shot and later succumbed to his injuries in hospital.

Gayathri lifts Super Singer Junior 10 trophy, wins villa worth Rs 60 lakhGayathri won the title of Vijay Television's Super Singer Junior 10, while Nasreen became the first runner-up. Kamal Haasan and AR Rahman were the chief guests for the musical night.

Sophie Turner turns cheerleader for Joe Jonas's new divorce-inspired albumSophie Turner extended her support for her ex-husband Joe Jonas's solo album, 'Music for People Who Believe in Love'. This move came months after the two parted ways.

Lalu Yadav removes son Tej Pratap from party, family after row over viral postOn Saturday, Tej Pratap Yadav declared his long-standing relationship with Anushka Yadav, saying that they have been in love and in a relationship for the past 12 years.

Naxal carrying Rs 5 lakh bounty killed in gunfight in Jharkhand's LateharThe Naxalite was killed in an encounter with police that lasted from late Sunday night to Monday morning. Palamu DIG YS Ramesh has confirmed the killing of the Naxalite.

sports.headline: Who can challenge Carlos Alcaraz on clay in the post-Nadal era? French Open 2025 ushers in a new era with Carlos Alcaraz poised to defend his crown. With Sinner surging, Djokovic seeking redemption, and dark horses in the mix, Paris is set for a gripping battle to decide the next ruler of Roland Garros.

SRH's final game serves a reminder of an IPL season that could have beenSRH beat KKR with a scintillating display of batting in their final game of the IPL 2025. The performance served a reminder of the season that could have been for SRH.

Relieved I didn't face Nadal: Federer recalls French Open 2009 winRoger Federer went down the memory lane to his French Open 2009 win, saying that he was relieved after not facing Rafael Nadal, who won the title four times from 2005 to 2008.

Given Shami's quality, he will bounce back strongly next season: SRH coachSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) head coach Daniel Vettori has backed fast bowler Mohammed Shami to bounce back strongly next season after his forgettable return to the Indian Premier League (IPL). Shami picked just six wickets from nine matches as he looked completely out of rhythm for the entire season.

Harsh Dubey will become a complete all-rounder by next IPL season: Daniel VettoriSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) head coach Daniel Vettori has backed rising star Harsh Dubey to grow immensely as an all rounder by the next season of the Indian Premier League (IPL).

Batters took undue pressure: Rahane dissects KKR's poor seasonIPL 2025: Skipper Ajinkya Rahane said that poor batting led to Kolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) downfall in the tournament. The Knights finished their campaign with a 110-run defeat to the Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH).

Day 2 Order of Play: Swiatek, Alcaraz, Sinner begin campaignFrench Open 2025, Day 2 Order of Play: Defending champions Carlos Alcaraz and Iga Swiatek will begin their campaign on Monday. The likes of Jannik Sinner, Naomi Osaka and Paula Badosa will also be in action.

Ben Shelton bounces back from trouble to fend off Lorenzo SonegoFrench Open 2025: Ben Shelton defeated Italy's Lorenzo Sonego 6-4, 4-6, 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 in his maiden appearance at Philippe-Chatrier on Sunday, May 25.

Will Suresh Raina return as CSK batting coach? Assistant bowling coach respondsFormer India batter Suresh Raina hinted on air that he has been approached to take up the role of batting coach at Chennai Super Kings. However, CSK assistant coach Sridharan Sriram neither confirmed nor denied Raina's potential return to the franchise in any capacity.

What makes Suryakumar Yadav so consistent? Will Jacks explainsWill Jacks revealed what makes Suryakumar Yadav so consistent in the IPL as the MI batter continues his fine run this season. Suryakumar has scored 583 runs in 13 matches this season.

SRH cannot play worse than they did in IPL 2025: CumminsSunRisers Hyderabad captain Pat Cummins believes his team should have reached the final of the IPL this season. He reflected on the team's inconsistent middle phase and expressed optimism for next season.

Day 2 Order of Play: Swiatek, Alcaraz, Sinner begin campaignFrench Open 2025, Day 2 Order of Play: Defending champions Carlos Alcaraz and Iga Swiatek will begin their campaign on Monday. The likes of Jannik Sinner, Naomi Osaka and Paula Badosa will also be in action.

Ben Shelton bounces back from trouble to fend off Lorenzo SonegoFrench Open 2025: Ben Shelton defeated Italy's Lorenzo Sonego 6-4, 4-6, 3-6, 6-2, 6-2 in his maiden appearance at Philippe-Chatrier on Sunday, May 25.

Will Suresh Raina return as CSK batting coach? Assistant bowling coach respondsFormer India batter Suresh Raina hinted on air that he has been approached to take up the role of batting coach at Chennai Super Kings. However, CSK assistant coach Sridharan Sriram neither confirmed nor denied Raina's potential return to the franchise in any capacity.

What makes Suryakumar Yadav so consistent? Will Jacks explainsWill Jacks revealed what makes Suryakumar Yadav so consistent in the IPL as the MI batter continues his fine run this season. Suryakumar has scored 583 runs in 13 matches this season.

SRH cannot play worse than they did in IPL 2025: CumminsSunRisers Hyderabad captain Pat Cummins believes his team should have reached the final of the IPL this season. He reflected on the team's inconsistent middle phase and expressed optimism for next season.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
